thread.title: New Canaan U-12 girls have two-win weekend
thread.title_full: New Canaan U-12 girls have two-win weekend

author: Dave Stewart
title: New Canaan U-12 girls have two-win weekend
text: By Dave Stewart on October 8, 2015 in Sports , Sports Lead , Youth Sports · 0 Comments The second round of the CT Cup got off to a cold start last Saturday, but the New Canaan U12 girls Red Team was able to control the ball and Kiki Brainard created a quick pass to Kaleigh Harden, who scored the first goal. That same duo netted the second goal before Jade Lowe fired off a quick shot and picked up the third goal as New Canaan moves on to the next round of the CT Cup. On Sunday, New Canaan’s defense was tested at the start by FUSA Red Fusion as Maiah Oyekanmi, Emma Lamaker, Angelia Megdanis, Meghan Driscoll, Kiera Mastey and Ashley Barton worked hard to keep the ball out of the New Canaan goal against four shots. However, FUSA was able to capitalize on a direct kick. In the second half, forwards Avery Minter, Hollis Mulry, Hadley Beiles and Kaleigh Griffiths helped put on the pressure, and Harden fired a shot from the right and hit the far upper corner of the goal to tie the score. Harden then passed to Grace Crowell for the game-winner. New Canaan’s Meghan Driscoll keeps pace with an opponent during a recent win for the U-12 Red Team.
